original_title: Distant Quasars: Shedding Light on Black Holes
overview: How can scientists study a faraway black hole that emits no light? By observing its quasar. As objects get pulled onto the accretion disk orbiting a supermassive black hole, friction creates a bright light known as a quasar. In this video, researchers use a “galaxy-sized lens” to analyze light from a distant quasar—revealing a supermassive black hole with a truly voracious appetite.

production_companies.name: The American Museum of Natural History

title: Distant Quasars: Shedding Light on Black Holes
